section.title: Sequences
section.para: Sequences can be used in any template string loaded from the scenario configuration. They are typically used to customize messages in a way that each message sent is unique.

A Sequence only implements two methods. First, reset() to reset the Sequence to its initial state, and second getNext() to obtain the next value in the row. The Sequences are used heavily by many threads. Therefore they must be thread-safe and handle the load smart.
A wrong example is the NumberSequence which has the getNext() method synchronized. This makes a significant overhead to the PerfCake performance.
Much better example is the PrimitiveNumberSequence which uses AtomicLong internally.
